text: Pours unclear brown with a brown head. Aroma of butterscotch, vanilla, toffee, bourbon, candy, ripe plums and figs. Taste of ripe plums, bourbon, caramel, dried apricots and sweet toffee.

From bottle. Pours a hazy Brown with a small yellowish off White head. Aroma has toffee, bourbon, Dark dried fruits, prunes. Taste is sweet and light fruity acidic. Light tobacco. Full body and a low carb.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle @ Forstadsshare. Pours dark muddy brown with a small offwhite head. Aromas of bread, caramel, malt, vanilla, toffee, booze. Taste is malty, caramel, vanilla, dark fruits, toffee, light bitterness left.

Refrigerated 12 oz. brown bottle from FlandersNed poured into a snifter. Medium brown with small beige head. Aroma is rich caramel, medium/thick body, some small bubble lacing. Taste is is rich caramel, toffee, some bourbon, a little wood, and hints of tobacco. Alcohol is well covered and this is a beautiful complex beer.
Bottle from the importer. The abv disappears in the flavors of malt and wood experience.

(Kuhnhenn Fourth Dementia (4D) Old Ale - Bourbon Barrel) Bottle 355ml, gold foil on the neck, vintage 2012. Served into a snifter, ABV 13.5%
Dark brown colour on the body, small and thin beige head on top with average retention.
The aroma has lots of bourbon, soy sauce, chocolate, some alcohol after a deep sniff, toffee, vanilla.
Taste is sweet woth caramel, toffee, dark malts, lots of bourbon, chocolate, light mocha, vanilla, quite some alcohol and its burn, molasses, wood.
Medium to thick body with soft carbonation.
Fantastic.
2015 bottle. Pours a brownish color. Aroma and taste are caramel, dark fruits, bourbon, and toffee.

Kuhnhenn 4th D - unfortunately I have no idea which vintage this is, due to a missing vintage label: stored it in the fridge for about a year.

Pours a dark brown color with a quickly disappearing khaki brown head.

Smells of unsweetened coconut shell, earth and scented wood, enriched by dried grapes and old oak. Offers a nice Bourbon spiciness which gets entangled into toasted nuts and grilled corn. Surprisingly earthy, focussing on the barrel without turning just a tad too sweet, creating a spicy, warm complexity on the nose which is awesome. 

Drinks truly soft, establishing a great silkness, which unfolds the Bourbon in all its powerfull facets. Its hot bite gets balanced by the rich toasty malt base, creating a powerful, complex beer.

Tastes of sugar glazed malts, a hint of licorice, dusty woodbark and toasty, bready malts. Spicy, sweet cinnamon and bakers chocolate add to the malt backbone, while a warming Boubon sharpness slowly becomes more and more recognizable. Ends sweet with a well integrated booziness, showcasing even more tongue tickling spices and toasty toffee malts. Finished very clean and soft, with a heavy Bourbon appearance defining the taste.

Masterfully balanced, intense beer, reminding of a Barley Wine at first glance, which from there on transforms into something different. All flavors work very harmoniously together, exhibiting a slowly uprising Bourbon sweetness which reveals a respectable amount of earth and bread. At its peak sweet toffee and scented wood add to the taste, never forgetting its rustic, bready roots. Finishes utmost clean after revealing its breathtaking complexity, calm after unleashing an intense flavor storm on the palate. Despite its taste intensity the beer drinks incredibly soft and almost easy if it wasnt for the perfectly integrated Bourbon, which works so good with the beers profound malt foundation.

Où, Quand, Comment : 
Bouteille, dégustée le 7/7/2013. 


Visuel :  
Couleur : brune foncée. 
Apparence : quasi-opaque. 


Arôme :  

Caramel, boisé (bourbon), fruité (raisins, figues), alcool, léger de vanille, notes de pain.


Goût :  
Entrée de bouche : Goût fruité (raisin, prunes, figues, gâteau de fruits) avec un goût boisé (bourbon) avec des notes de vanille et réglisse noire. 
Une dominante maltée de caramel est présente avec un léger goût dalcool ainsi que des notes de chocolat et de mélasse. 


En bouche :  

Corps : ronde.
Effervescence : moyenne-douce.
Texture : riche et huileuse.
Finale : longue, composée dune légère amertume dalcool avec un goût boisé ainsi quun résiduel sucré et fruité.

Bottle vintage 2011 from The Drunk Monk, Mataro - Spain. Color: dark black brown beer with no carbonation and no foam. Smell: intensive caramel and sweet nose. Toffee. Barrel and alcohol finish. You feel the malt complexity on the nose. Taste: full body very intensive malt and caramel. Superb oily palate. Really amazing. Superb attenuation, sweet and toffee. Aftertaste: sweet malt caramel and alcohol.

Bottle in trade from Rightcross55, thanks Matt! 2010 bottle. Dark caramel brown pour. Amazing aroma, oak, vanilla, caramel. Taste follows, a little boozy, missing some carbonation due to age but really good stuff.

Pours a dark, date-colored brown with a thin, lasting white head. Aroma is dark fruits, dates, plum, brown sugar, oak, vanilla, caramel, and light boozy notes. Flavor is sweet caramel, toffee, oak, vanilla, and dark fruits - hides the booze well. Flavor has an odd, almost soapy off-flavor as well as an astringent mouthfeel that interrupts the thick, syrupy, chewy body. Maybe its the batch. This is still a delicious beer with an intoxicating aroma.

Draught sample at CBC 2014.
Big sticky sweet dessert like beer with toffee, bourbon, figs and vanilla. Massive, but a nice sipper, snd I think its got more complexity underneath to offer.

Bottle at James for his 11k tasting. Pours a clear brown with a thin white head. Wood and bourbon on the nose, chocolate and cocoa. Medium-bodied, warm roast. Cocoa, chocolate, warm and boozy, long malt and warming alcohol. Lovely.

2014 release. Alc. 13.5% by Vol. Pours dark caramel brown with a small khaki head. Head retention is ok. AROMA: rich malt, caramel, coffee, chocolate, toffee, bourbon barrel char, smoke, vanilla, earthy, alcohol, roasty, nuts, spices, molasses, brown sugar, slight honey, slight herbs and faint tobacco. TASTE: rich malt, peppercorns, coriander, alcohol, caramel, coffee, dark bitter chocolate, bourbon barrel char, roasty, nuts, smoke, vanilla, toffee, burned brown sugar, molasses, earthy, spices and light herbs. AFTER TASTE: bourbon barrel char, molasses, toffee, spices and coffee bitterness with a rich fizzy spiced finish.

Pours from the bottle into a deep dark black cherry color. A strong woody aroma with a lot of dark fruit mixed in. But cherry and apple flavor upfront with a lot of barrel. Bourbon flavors come in through the end. Amazingly smooth flavor. Very dangerous sipper. Great stuff.

12oz bottle of delishiousness! 2013 dated bottle - gotta try a vertical of these... Chestnut brown hue, moderate height tan head. Aged citrus, nut & dark/stone fruit nose & flavor. Nice bourbon booziness and sweet malt. Full-body and moderate carbonation.
Bottle. Brown pour with tan head. Sweet vanilla, spice, boozy, bourbon aromas. Bourbon, vanilla, candy, vanilla, spice and fruit Flavors.

355ml bottle enjoyed @ home, thanks to Yeaster. Pours very dark brown with a small but steady tan head. Aroma is prunes, dates, raisins, caramel, wood, vanilla, overripe berries and bourbon. Taste is sweet, a little sour. Full bodied, creamy yexture, soft - almost no carbonation. Finish is complex and long.

From tap. Dark brown color with small beige head. Malty aroma, light roasted, caramel, light chocolate, dark dried fruits, berries, vanilla, wood, alcohol. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

12oz bottle from Kuhnhenn. Pours a rich chocolate brown. Aroma is caramel, brown sugar, molasses, alcohol. Flavor is caramel, vanilla extract, subtly metallic, raisins, toffee. Finish is bitter and lingering, not sweet at all like the nose would indicate. Overall, a great beer that will only improve with cellaring. This is from yesterdays release.

12oz bottle pours dark red brown with small head. Tons of rich toffee, dark fruit, caramel, butterscotch, leather and oaky bourbon in the nose. Palate follows this profile with super creamy mouthfeel, well integrated oaky vanilla, caramel bread, touch of raisin, dried fruit. Finishes somewhat sweet with sticky caramel, vanilla, bourbon, dried dark fruit, chocolate, old leather. Top notch brew.

12 oz. bottle shared by Willrunforbeer. 2011 vintage. Dirty brown without head, aroma is awesome mild bourbon treatment sitting on top of raisins, sugar coated figs and burnt molasses.
For the flavor the bourbon is exactly what the flavor needed to help balance the overly sweet flavors. This variant is not as sweet as the base beer I sampled 2 minutes before this. Mouthfeel is slightly syrupy but again the bourbon transform it into a very nice slightly warming alcohol with a mild warming after the swallow. The bourbon works wonders for this. Great share Brian, owe you for this one!

12oz bottle from trade. 2011 vintage. Pours muddy brown without a head. Aroma is molasses, spice, vanilla. I could be sniffing a fresh baked cookie. The bourbon really helps balance this beer. Taste is molasses, raisin, date, vanilla, bourbon, oak in the finish. Great beer!

Thank you, Secret Santa. This beer is just right. Deep and full dark brown, very little head, but a second after you pour a subtle, off-white foam appears. Smell is banana bread, honey, molasses, booze. Sweet, thick, creamy. Truly fantastic.
Pours a deep burnt sienna color with a finger of eggshell foam. Round sweet molasses, caramel, boozy raisin, leather, soft bourbon, lingering nuttiness, toasted oak. Yum !

Slightly hazy brown colour, off-white head. Aroma of caramel, raisins and brown sugar. Sweet malty flavour, caramel, molasses. Quite full body. Sweet finish, nuts, bourbon, raisins.(from draught @ CBC green session, Copenhagen 2014. Vintage 2012.)

Bottle, courtesy of a kind soul... shared in a location remote of my dining room.
Pours a muddy reddish brown with almost no head. 

The aroma is huge on cooked fruit, vanilla, cherries, and bourbon in general. 

The flavor of th beer is fairly boozy with some blood orange and some candied fruit. Its fairly sweet with some toffee & vanilla. Its complex, but not complicated... generally very tasty. 

snice

Bottle from BlowOffTube, thanks for the opportunity! 
Ruby brown color with a smallish off white head that dissipates quickly. Toffee, fruity, vanilla, and light oak with hints of molasses and alcohol make up most of the aroma. Smells quite sweet but I like it. The flavor is sweet and fruity with bits of caramel and burnt sugars. Light vanilla and wood with some solid warming alcohol. Thick body with a sweet sticky mouthfeel. Great sipper!

On tap at Kuhnhenn. Pour is a deep mahogany, plum colored hues. A small off-white head fades to a couple dashes of lacing. Aromas of bold molasses, bourbon, wet oak, over-ripe fruits (raisin, plum, cherries), vanilla, caramel, toffee....just a bouquet of aroma! Taste is equally as complex and bold. Loads of bourbon and oak hit you quickly, but the sting fades to a harmony of sweet molasses, plum, raisin, caramel...then hints of oak, vanilla, port wine and char give it some edge. A final dose of oaked bourbon hits you on the way down, but its the ripe fruits and molasses that leave the lasting impression. Delicious stuff!!

Tap @ Kuhnhenn: Opaque, sienna-brown color with a dark beige, creamy head that doesnt last for very long. Aroma is HUGE. Incredible powerful. Heavily boozy oak, vanilla, bourbon & toffee coated dark prunes, raisins, sticky caramel, toasted notes underneath, tons of residual sweetness clashing with robust booze & warmth. Wow. Super creamy & thick on the palate. Bourbon infused dark fruits out of the gate; dates, figs, currant. Toasted brown sugar sweetness, caramel, toffee candy, vanilla, & even light notes of burnt marshmallow. Lots of wood, lots of oak, & lots of bourbon from start to finish. A flavor that is truly intense & lasts for days, finishing with vanilla, wood, prunes, bourbon, & buttery toffee. Have had this aged for one, two, three, & four years. Great every time.

Draught at CBC 2014. Murky copper liquid with a medium off-white head. Aroma of bourbon, raw sugar, caramel, wood and toffee. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter with notes of bourbon and raw sugar. Full bodied with low carbonation. Wow. Everything I hoped it would be. Great bourbon aroma and lots of toffee notes.

Bottle, 2011 vintage, third beer of Christmas Day. Pours a nearly opaque chestnut with no head. Aroma is deep complex malts, roasted plum, and sweet bourbon  Im reminded a bit of King Henry, or at least my memory of it  with molasses, sherry, tart cherry, light oak, alcohol vapors, and faint soy. Taste is sweet plum, caramel, and cola fading into a boozy, bourbony middle and finishing with roast, bitter chocolate, scorched caramel, earth, raisins, and oak. Still hot even after a few years and somewhat thin mouthfeel. Good but not sure Im on board with the hype; this may be over the hill.
12oz bottle to snifter. Dark brown. Thin ring. Dark brown sugary sweetness. Some dark yummy fruits but mostly just burnt sugar and booze.

Bottle - Vintage 2013 - Butterscotch, vanilla, bourbon, and raisin. Deep cloudy brown with a small off white head. Bourbon, anise, raisin, plum and a bit of roast with barrel notes throughout. Nice, but I actually like the regular better.
Very dark brown in the glass. Small head, very fruity and boozy. One to drink again if i can get my hands on it.
Dark brown with no head. Sweet coffee/toffee and caramel aroma. High sweet alcohol finish.

Aroma is sweet, butterscotch, toffee, oak barrel. Appearance is apple cider brown, light tan head. Taste is much the same as the aroma, super complex, the barrel adds a lot of booze qualities and a new character. Mouthfeel is perfect, creamy, thick, lovely. Overall, I love this beer, but prefer the original 4D to the barrel-aged counterpart.

"Wish list cross off. Very sweet on the aroma and flavor, but the body is so smooth as to be bordering on ridiculous. I didnt get a vintage, but do remember this one coming in at a whopping 13.5%, with very little heat. Flavor and aroma of vanilla, caramel, toffee, fruit, brown sugar & bourbon. Little to no hop presence. Maybe some slightly roasted malts in there as well. A beautiful sipper. Deserving of the 100/100 on RB."
Tap at CBC 2014. Beer in the glass dark brown, nice head. Heavy malty aroma. Starts fiery-malty, alcoholic, woody, earthy. Some spicy hints. Finish still strong and fiery. Could be more balanced.

2012 bottle opened in 2014. Pours muddy red brown with no head. Aroma is nutty, allspice, slightly floral. Taste is like sticky pudding; lots of toffee here with some great bourbon notes in the background. Super smooth and deceptively drinkable.
Pours cloudy iced tea brown with no head. The nose is tobacco, caramel, sweet bourbon, vanilla. The taste is bourbon, molasses, beachnut chew, wood and vanilla. Medium bodied. Very good. 4.5

2012 vintage 330 ml bottle at home. Pours deep brown amber with a tiny light beige head. Rich vanilla and milk chocolate nose, raisins and fresh forest nut aromas, deep caramel. Rich body, vanilla sweetness and slight bitterness, with quite some heat, yet well balanced with the sweetness. Taste of rich salty caramel and tangerine bitterness. Nice!

Bottiglia 355ml (2011), ordinata su domus birrae e bevuta a casa.
Color caramello bruciato praticamente senza schiuma.
Corpo oleoso e potente, lalcol si fa sentire sul finale, scaldando parecchio.
Malti in evidenza già al naso, che proseguono in bocca, legnosità ed una punta di bourbon. Finale amaro ed alcolico.
Difficile ma imponente.

Tap sample at CBC 2014. Dark clear mahogany body, medium creamy off-white head. Nose is sweet caramel, burnt sugar, toffee, vanilla, bourbon and hints of wood, peanuts and alcohol. Taste is bourbon, vanilla, wood, peanuts, alcohol, muscovado sugars and hints of syrup and caramel. Full body, medium carbonation. Lovely strong and sweet stuff again from Kuhnhenn.

Draught at CBC 2014. Pours a deep brown with a small off-white head. Aroma is of toasted malt and caramel. Taste is of sweet dark fruits, malt, chocolate, vanilla and bourbon. Overall short aftertaste, although notes of the barrel ageing sticks around for a while. Medium body and carbonation. Very good for an ale, but it really is the barrel ageing that makes it something special.
Smakprov på CBC 2014. Smak och doft av torkad frukt som fikon och dadlar, bourbon, choklad, russin, choklad och vanilj, Rund ,krämig och len. Stor sötma som balanseras upp av alkoholen. Mycket fin.

Sample at CBC 2014. Poured a murky dark brown with a thin light tan head. The aroma is rich fruit sticky treacle toffee. The flavour is medium sweet with a rich sticky toffee pudding palate. Full bodied with soft carbonation. Where is the alcohol? Thats the sign of a great beer.

Smakprov på CBC 2014. Stor söt kropp och mycket Bourbon. Fudge, knäck, vanilj, fat, russin, ddadlar, fikon och mycket bourbon. Stor och söt men alkoholen balanserar en hel del. Stora smaker, komplex och söt. Riktigt bra.

Sample @ CBC. Pours dark red brownish with a small tan head. Aroma is lots of bourbon up front, vanilla, oak, caramel, figs. Taste is sweet, vanilla caramel, figs, bourbon. Medium/full bodied with a smooth and creamy texture, lasting bourbon sweetness.

Fad på CBC: Masser af vanilie fra bourbonen i duften på denne brunlige øl. Det er især dette der trækker ratingen op da den faktisk ikke har så forfærdeligt meget andet at byde. Igen eneste negative oplevelse på denne ølfestival var betjeningen på denne stand.

Tap @ CBC 2014. Pours hazy chestnut with a small, creamy, beige film head. Aroma has fat caramel, Bourbon, sweetness, vinious. Medium to low carbonation, fat and oily mouthfeel. Flavour has good Bourbon, vanilla, fat caramel, apple. Extremely sweet.
CBC 2014. 2012 vintage. Hazy dark amber, almost no head or lacing. Bourbon, oak, caramel, toffee, brown sugar, fruity, alcohol, milk chocolate, apple.

On tap at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2014, and happily my 1000th rate. Mahogany with a decent tan head. Aroma is raisins, dates, bourbon, honey, vanilla, brown sugar, prunes, hint of cinnamon. Full bodied, syrupy mouthfeel, sweet and luxurious on the palate with a fruity sweet and warming finish. Taste is raisins, dates, milk chocolate, caramel, honeycomb,pale syrup, vanilla, fudge, bourbon, apple brandy, English toffee. Incredible
Lots of Carmel and toffee characteristics. Pretty good and boozy but hidden. I would recommend Central Waters Barleywine more...

Bottle, thnx to lionsandbeer and bierkoning for sending me two vintages, both 2010 and 2012. Pours a clear dark brown beer with a medium amount of off white head on top. Aroma is mostly booze and licorice with some sweet, oaky touches mixed in it. Flavor has loads of barrel characters, cloying sweet and very, very malty and boozy. Great sipper, long cloying sweet aftertaste. Very nice brew, but only a bit unbalanced. Doesnt mess up the beer at all!

Bottle shared by Dave. Aroma of dark fruits, some nice oak, and raisins. Pours bronze with a small white head. Taste is raisin, fig, vanilla, bourbon and a dusty malt. Great old ale. Not too overwhelmingly sweet. Great stuff.

Dark brown pour with minimal head. Aromas of bourbon, oak, raisins, and brown sugar. Flavor is big sweet dark fruits upfront with bourbon barrel notes coming through immediately after. A bit boozy and really sweet, this one is a slow sipper for sure. All around, pretty good brew.

UPDATED: MAY 16, 2014 Flaska 2011. Hemma hos Wallén. Trade (thanks STLWill). Första tanken i doften är engelsk barleywine. Visst inslag av fruktiga nyanser (hallon?). Små maltkristaller kring flaskhalsen vid kapsylen blir man ju lite nervös av. Positivt oxiderad men vinner garanterat inte på längre lagring. Lite honung och läder visar sig efter några klunkar. Lever inte riktigt upp till förväntningarna. Påminner en hel del om originalet.    
----    
Tap på CBC-14. Kul att få göra en re-rate på den här och lyfta den lite. Härlig bourbon i doften. Sötma och torkad frukt, mest russin. Bra. Så här ska den vara. Ingen negativ oxidering.
Draft at MBG Winter Festival - pours a cloudy brown. Bourbon , bready, dark fruit aromas. Heavy malt punch with very sweet bourbon and some warming alcohol. Very good.
Bottle pours murky brown with low head and carb. Aroma is sweet dark fruits and bourbon oak. Taste is similar with a thick sweet booze finish, but easy to drink
Had a taste on tap at the brewery. Way too boozy and sweet for my taste. Full of raisiny booze flavors.

2012 vintage, 12 oz bottle. One of those legendary American beers I absolutely had to try. Pours a dark maroon with a very small lingering head. Aroma has a woody and pleasant bourbon character. Vanilla and butterscotch, booze and oak. The taste is booze on the onset, with a mellow vanilla present throughout the entire palate. Dried fruits: figs, grapes, sweet cherries. Finish is a nice hop kick with the booze creeping up at the end. Booze warmth, but nowhere near as agressive as the ABV would suggest. Dried fruits linger in the mouth for minutes after drinking. Overall, an extremely well-balanced barleywine, old ale or whatever you like to call it. Especially for someone like me, that doesnt particularly fancy the style. These tend to be overly sweet, but this one hits all the right notes.

UPDATED: FEB 25, 2014 Bottle from drfabulous. A dark brownish-amber color pours out with a small tan head on top. Just spots of lacing cling to the sides of the glass. Smells great; bourbon, wood, and quite a bit of raisin. A little cherry and vanilla as I dig deeper. Warming and boozy going down; just enough alcohol burn for that ahhh feeling. The carbonation is low-moderate and works well with this beer. The bourbon and wood drive the flavors but theres a lot of other things going on here: soft vanilla character, raisins, dark plums, semi-sweet caramel. Like a new layer for each part of the sip. A near perfect sipper. Ive got to give Kuhnhenn credit, they seem to have mastered the big, boozy beers.

2012 bottle. Pours cloudy brown, with a small, tan head. Aroma aroma is caramel, fruit, malt, bourbon, and vanilla, Flavor is caramel, bourbon, vanilla, dark fruit, malt, and alcohol. Heavy body, with a long finish.

Intense flavors of caramel, bourbon, raisins, cherries, plum, and molasses stand out. Undertones of cinnamon, rich wood, vanilla, cider and biscuit. Hints of coffee and dark chocolate round out the complex list of flavors. Very diverse range of flavors all blended together well. A bit too much bite from the alcohol but thats to be expected.

Bottled 2012

This beer is ugly as fuck. Pours thick, sludgy, brown, flat appearing. Smells goddam sexual: toffee, marshmallow, bourbon, vanilla, graham, all things nice and a touch of tawny port and some minerals. Flavor follows suit with the same descriptors adding brown sugar and a touch of heat. FUll bodied with low carb and a semi dry finish. Nice beer, a little fucked outside the two most important parts: nose and taste, but otherwise could be world class.

Bottle shared by alexsdad06. 2011. Bottle pour opaque dark brown. Nose bourbon, toasted malt, toffee. Taste thick mouthfeel. Nutty, caramel, sweet malt, interesting toasted nut finish. Bourbon well integrated, not overpowering. 
C4 m4 n7 t8 o4.1

On tap at Kuhnhenn for the Winter Solstice. The pour is a really dark brown with hints of ruby and an off white thin head. Heavy complex aromas of marshmallow, vanilla, bourbon and caramel. The flavor is similar. A little more booziness than is detected in the nose, but the mouth feel is perfect. Just thick enough and the flavors last greatly. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2012. Chalk and gritty texture but an overall smooth drink with lots of dark fruit and nice subtle complexity. Chocolate and vanilla, wood and oak flavors, followed by some plum prune and toffee. You get it all here. Ricidulously smooth for the alcohol content. Aromas of candy toffee and sugar sweetness. Nice dark winter beer you should sip by the fire. Syrupy sweetness that lasts a while. Roasty bittersweet coffee malt aromas and finish.

12oz bottle (2011) shared by dmac for his 3,500th rate. Congrats on being an alcoholic bro! Pours a dark amber brownish color with absolutely zero head. Big boozy aroma full of bourbon, caramel, oak, and hints of dark fruits. Taste is also super boozy with a warm alcohol burn, but in a good way. Notes of bourbon, oak, light hints of dark fruit, and an amazing aftertaste of rich butterscotch! Very nice!

12oz bottle from a trade a long long time ago. Poured a muddy blackish brown with a smaller to nonexistant beige tight foamy head. Aroma is nice, syrupy and big overall with notes of vanilla and toffee, barrel, wood, butterscotch, some bourbon. Full body with light carbonation and a syrupy mouthfeel that lingers with light heat. Flavor is the same as the aroma, a bit hotter with the alcohol, bourbon, vanilla, wood, dry breads, slight raisin, butterscotch candy. Good stuff.

2012 bottle. Pours dark copper in color with a dissipating head that ends up leaving a fine layer of foam and a ring that hugs my glass. The aroma is full of bourbon, vanilla, carmel malts, very toffee like, and a hint of dark fruit. In tasting I noticed medium levels of sweet bourbon, rich malt flavor, sweet syrup like sugars, vanilla, hint of oak, and figs. The finish is moderately bitter with a lingering of booze and sweetness. The beverage balances well for a high abv brew. Overall this is a must try for barrel aging fans.

Thanks to jrob21 for bringing this supremely delicious beer over. Pours as dark as brown can be without being black with a relatively small brownish tan head. Scent is candy, bourbon, and booze. Bourbon flavor blends extremely well with sweet old ale flavors. Thick as mud. Bottle - Share from jrob21

Bottle share thanks to Homer321, 2011....pours a muddy, brownish color. Big bourbon, malty, toffee, caramel, dark fruit aroma. Big malty flavor, toffee, melanoidans, sweet vanilla, chocolately flavor. Not much barrel character.

Bottle. Pours no head. Murky. Muddled. Area of soy sauce and Munich malt. Lots of oxidation. Taste is similar. Very thick and chewy. Pretty good. Not getting much barrel tho. Very light on the barrel character. Not a lot of alcohol in the flavor or mouthfeel especially for 13.5% boost. Good.

Dark copper color, small brown head. Vanilla and toffee in the nose. Full-bodied. Sweet, toffeish, vanilla, some wood and alcohol. Sticky. Quite straightforward.

Deep brown with a ruby undertone, light tan head and slight carbonation. Nice bourbon aroma, sweet caramel, vanilla, marshmallow, dark fruits. Incredible complex bourbon and vanilla, molasses and caramel, oak and fig. Good god this is great. Thanks Ian!

12 ounce bottle into signature tulip glass, 2011 Winter Solstice bottling. Pours dense nearly pitch black color with a small dense tan head with good retention, that reduces to a patchy lace cap that lingers. Minimal spotty lacing clings on the glass. Aromas of huge caramel, toffee, molasses, brown sugar, maple syrup, raisin, toast, vanilla, bourbon, oak, dark bread, tobacco, light cocoa, and toasted earthiness. Absolutely insane aromas with great balance and complexity of malt and barrel notes; with great strength. Taste of huge caramel, toast, toffee, molasses, maple syrup, raisin, brown sugar, vanilla, bourbon, oak, dark bread, light cocoa, light tobacco, and toasted earthiness. Lingering notes of caramel, toast, toffee, maple syrup, molasses, brown sugar, vanilla, bourbon, oak, dark bread, light cocoa, and toasted earthiness on the finish for a while. Incredible complexity of malt and barrel flavors; with a perfect barrel/malt balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Light carbonation and very full bodied; with a very creamy, slick, and lightly syrupy mouthfeel that is incredible. Alcohol is very well hidden with only a slight warming present after the finish. Overall this is an absolutely world class old ale! All around insane complexity and balance of malt and barrel flavors; and dangerously smooth to sip on considering the very high ABV. Unbelievably amazing offering.

UPDATED: NOV 7, 2013 Thx to Kraddel! 355 ml. bottle shared. Pours murky brown, like swamp-water with zero head or visible carb. Smells like bourbon goo, vanilla, very sweet choc, oodles of vanilla, flowers, sugar, cocoa, pure cane sugar syrup. Very sweet soy & vanilla goo taste, milk chocolate, cane sugar syrup, very sweet with cocoa, more vanilla, sweet white choc. Flat, warming, syrupy. Pretty nice, expected a smidge more, this is a bit messy but very enjoyable still.

Pours murkey brown , no head at all. 
smell is intense bourbon , sweet , syrupy malts 
Low carbo

Had on-tap at the Kuhnhenn Brewery on a paddle.

Appearance: Pretty nice. About a finger of a tan head and surprisingly decent lacing. The beer is a dark brown color with red when held to light. Looks better than I expected... I thought it may look flat.

Smell: Compared to the standard 4D (11), this had a lot of caramel. There was also quite a lot of darker fruits there as well. The vanilla notes that youd expect from barrel aging werent really there all that much. A very nice smelling beer all the same.

Taste: Having side-by-side with the regular 4D, this was definitely a bit more mellow, as one would expect given the barrel. Its not a huge difference, but its noticeable. The mouth feel is maybe a bit thicker. The taste itself on this one just isnt on par with the regular 4D... of course, thats just my humble opinion. The BB4D mellows out the fruity notes quite considerably and replaces them with a maltier, sweeter flavor. Its still excellent, but not quite as tasty.

Im extremely happy to have gotten the chance to try this beer. I dont think its as legendary as some people said it would be (like I said, I preferred the standard 11 4D), but I liked it. Recommended.

2012 Vintage poured at 50 degrees into a FSW barrelworks tulip. 

A- Pours a viscous brown color with ruby hues when held to the light. A 1/2 inch beige head forms and quickly fades to a thick ring around the rim of the glass. Carbonation bubbles are apparent throughout. 

S- Bourbon. Vanilla. Alcohol. Some oak. A little bit of caramel and malty sweetness, but I cant tell if it is coming from the barrel or the base beer. Either way, this smells fantastic and very inviting. Only drawback is there is not a ton of complexity.

T- Up front, a really nice malty caramel sweetness along with some molasses and port-like cherry esters. On the back end, there is a huge blast of vanilla, bourbon, and some oak tannins along with a touch of bitterness to round things out. There is alcohol present, but no fusel or hot flavor. Spot on for the style. Wow- this is an amazing beer!

M- Luscious. Smooth, low carbonation that gives the beer a creamy feel. High body, although not overly sweet. Great balance between the tannic oak and high finishing gravity make this a smooth drinker. 

O- I was not expecting this beer to be so amazing. I want to rate this badly in a disguised attempt to trade for more of it, but it deserves better than that. Great winter time sipper that meshes bourbon and malt perfectly, without being an over the top, diabetic coma inducing sort of beer. Gimme more.

Decent amount of acidity in here to balance things out, which is pretty important for a potential sugar bomb like this. Pretty full mouthfeel with a finish of chocolate and alcohol heat. Tasted at the 1st Official Ledebronckx Barrel Aged Academie Grand Elite Tasting. Pours deep brown with orange highlights and a small head. Smell is licorice, chocolate, molasses and dark fruit. The taste is caramel, rich dark fruit, booze. A on of flavor - leaves the tongue dry. Thick body with mild carbonation. A treat.

Appearance:  Pours a amber tinted brown. With only a ring of tan.

Aroma:  Bourbon sweetness, ripe dark fruit, nouget, caramel, milk chocolate.



Taste:  Brown sugar, alcohol, wood, burnt caramel, semi sweet chocolate. Finishes warm and boozy.

Mouthfeel:  Full bodied. Meduim carbonation. Surprised this wasnt as sticky or thick for being such a big beer.

Overall:  An amazing treat that should probably be enjoyed as a sipper due to its strength and complexity.
Very sweet with strong raisin and plum flavors. I will have to try the regular version because I'm not sure the BB did this one any favors.

Trade from deyholla, part of an awesome box. Thanks! 2011 bottle. Pours cloudy dark brownish red with a hint of kahki head. Smell is an amazing blend of vanilla caramel, chocolate, oak, bourbon and maybe some brandy. Beautiful. Surprisingly mellow flavor. Bready malts and chocolate fade into strong vanilla oak and subtle caramel notes. Bourbon is there up front but dissapates into the complexity of the barrels quickly. Thick viscous mouthfeel almost like a stout. Almost like a caramello dipped in bourbon with vanilla ice cream on top. And yet the sweetness is not overpowering. Just fantastic.

Bottle at The Others Tasting, London - many thanks to Paul for providing this one. Pours lightly murky red-brown with pretty much no head. Nose of alcohol, ripe fruits, meat and sugary bread. Big sweet flavor, fairly boozy, with light earth, brown bread, some medicinal qualities, plums. Full bodied with soft carbonation and a chewy mouthfeel. Hot finish with some syrupy caramel, rich bread, dry toffee and light dirt. Somewhat tasty. Its not a graceful beer - at all - but there are some novel elements to it.

2012 vintage, 12 oz gold foil topped bottle into a Founders 15th anny glass. Thanks to steimie for this mega-want!

A - Pours a nearly opaque dark, dark brown body that is just a shade below black. Holding this up to the light creates a sheen of dark red illumination through the beer. One finger of light khaki foam forms but doesnt stick around long. A swirl generates a long lasting lace of tiny bubbles that falls down slowly leaving behind some alcohol legs. 

S - As soon as I cracked the bottle I got a huge whiff of bourbon and oak. The nose is strong on the dark fruits and vanilla. Dates, raisins, and mincemeat. A warming blast of alcohol followed by smooth and rich caramel, brown sugar, toffee, and marsh mallow. Spicy and woody with a lingering ethanol presence. The aroma does not hide its alcohol, instead it puts it on full display like a fine high proof bourbon.

T - Caramel, marshmallow, molasses, brown sugar, maple, raisins and some chocolate. Smooth and earthy english toffee with a smooth oak and vanilla finish. A very complex drinker with a plethora of sweet and decadent flavors attacking your tongue. The alcohol has a pleasing burn on the end.

M - Medium bodied and slick, well carbonated. Probably not for those who dont enjoy boozy beers. 

O - Very impressive BA old ale. Been wanting to try this beer for a long time and its certainly lived up to the hype. This beer is drinking phenomenally out of the gate, I have no idea why anyone would intentionally age this beer. Forever ISO!

12-oz at Mikkeller. After many years wishing I could get my hands on some of this stuff, it was a bit of a letdown. Thick, oily, dark brown body. Fairly clear. Flat. Intensely oaky sharp nose, lots of overcooked malt and alcohol fumes fighting with each other, along with some piercing apricot bourboniness. Thick, sludgey body. No real carb. Bitey, twangy mid palate showing dense malt crust, apricots, and vanilla. Managed to finish it but poured a lot for neighboring barstools in the process.

2010 bottle @ THE Others Tasting. Cheers to Scopey for sourcing this much talked-about brew! The pours a hazy deep red color with a tiny head. I get strong stilton blue cheese on the nose. General savory aromas. Meat drippings(?). These scents dominate some more subtle notes of toffee, caramelized cherry, cocoa powder. The taste is thick treacle. Pecan pie, golden syrup. Aggressive sweetness. More blue cheese. Chewy malts. Slightly hot finish. The mouthfeel isnt particularly full for such a big beer. Overall, not bad, but a bit of a letdown. The blue cheese flavors werent particularly welcomed. Despite this, the beer does have some charm, so its not a complete letdown. Perhaps the bottle-to-bottle variation in Kuhnhenn beers is significant.

2010 (bottle acquired via trade) at THE others tasting. It pours deep red-brown with a limited beige head. The nose is meaty, oxo cubes, beef, wood, earth, toasted coconut, hint of bourbon, faint blue cheese and some alcohol warmth. The taste is wood, meaty, earth, big alcohol warmth, bourbon, sticky dark fruit, caramel, dark chocolate and varnish, with a dry, warming finish. Full body, fine carbonation and sticky mouth-feel. Nice depth of flavour, but the alcohol warmth spoils it for me.
Bottle. Pours dark brown with no head.  Aroma is sweet bourbon and malts. Taste is bourbon, caramel and malts. This beer is really awesome actually.

This is hardcore. Ive had a lot of epic Michigan beers in the past few days ad this is the icing on the cake. Pours murky brown with good lacing, some head. Aromas of cherry, bourbon, red wine grapes and booze. Palate is a rollercoaster ride of sensation. Taste sweet and bitter. Tap at brewpub.

12oz bottle shared. As I was pouring into glasses I could smell the vanilla, caramel and bourbon. The aroma is as every bit as intense as I thought. Pours dark amber to brown with little brownish head. Just spending time on the aroma, amazing. The flavors are deep and rich. Caramel, vanilla, maybe some dark fruit. Super sweet but not cloyingly. Tis old ale hides the alcohol very well. Every bit as good as some of the top rated beers in the world.

12 oz. bottle from Ibrew2or3. Thanks Dave! It pours a brown with a tan head. It looks still as you pour it, but the foam slowly builds to a small tan layer before subsiding. It looks rather handsome in the glass. The aroma is just a seductive as I thought it would be with major bourbon influence with intense caramel, vanilla, some cherry and fig with hints of wood. Maybe a hint of cocoa. This is good as it gets for a barleywine/old ale. The flavor is kind of like a cherry cordialor maybe one of those Russian liquor filled chocolates. Anyway, its rich, warming and sweet. Slightly nutty from the bourbon and wood with a very thick, lightly syrupy body. The carbonation is low, but perceptible. Very appropriate for the style. The alcohol gets a little strong adding a hint of phenolics and thinning the finish. Fig and prunes come out more as it warms. Overall, a very satisfying brew and a nice after dinner treat.
Darker copper to brown pour and a khaki colored head. Brown sugar, molasses, caramelized, raisins. Sweet and chewy. Nutty finish. Really good.
Bottle from dcschiller. Cloudy brown with no head. Taste is sweet with dried fruit. Very low carbonation with thick sticky mouthfeel. Alcohol was hidden until it warmed more. Ver nice beer

Expensive bottle from Bierkoning, Amsterdamvintage 2011, 13.5% ABVDark brown color, with basically no head, just a few bubbles on the borders. The aroma is strong, roasted malts and phenol, dark chocolate; peculiar, not amazing. Roasted malt and coffee flavor, strong body, but just moderate sweetness; light liquorice and phenol, very light vanilla; quite strong alcohol warmth.No elegance, too much phenol, and excessive overall.

12 oz. bottle.  Pours a murky amber brown color with some soapy type bubbles posing as a head.  The aroma is sweet caramel, toffee, dark fruits, cherry, wood, bourbon and vanilla. Bottle  355 ml  
Aroma:   strong barrel feel , oak notes all fairly soft , even delicate for given strength. Mature feel. Some caramel sugars behind. 7+
Look:  murky brown with lighter top. 3+

4D .. small baby bottle .. . deep brown .. . light tar, old bourbon, and wet barrel .. . thin mouthfeel .. . no direction but overall it was tasty .. . . merry gobble gobble eve!
Great stuff here! Nose is prunes, chocolate, molasses, and bourbon. Very soft on the palate. Smooth. Taste is similar with a nice combination of chocolate, molasses, and bourbon. Awesome stuff.

This beer was great, it seemed to pour with almost no head, and had a very nice golden raisin color to it. Aromas were all raisins, wood, bourbon and molasses. The taste was full of sweet malts, soft oak flavors and a finish of mellow bourbon. Given the alcohol content I can say it was very hidden and easy to drink. Thanking OmegaX for this share.

Deep brown/black pour. Rich chewy malt aroma. An intense oak and bourbon component over a meaty sort of umami backbone. Intense and rich. A lot of vanilla and oak. Caramel and cooked toffee along with some figgy sweetness. Lovely brew.

2011 bottle to Double Bastard glass.  Totally flat, no carbonation.  Chalky dark leather brown pour.  From a distance I detected a slightly sour aroma which concerned me. Bottle at my 30th Birthday tasting. Pours hazy deep tawny, no read head, no real lacing. Nose is bourbon, maple, wood, stewed fruit, caramel. Fuck-tons of smoke here, which is awesome. Flavours of smoke, cocoa, toffee, plum, prune, date, raisin, cognac, spice. Just a spectacular brew!
This is the best old ale in the world bar none. The only thing closes old stock cellar reserve. Had it in Holland at a great  american craft beer bar. Cant wait to have it again! Cheers!

UPDATED: JAN 22, 2013  It pours a dark brown, more or less black with a fizzy and small light tan head. It quickly fizzes away with just a few specks of lacing. The bourbon and oak arent overpowering but still highly noticeable. There is a huge amount of dark fruits and a hint of soy. The taste is rich with bourbon and dark fruits. 2012 bottle. Slight funk in the smell. THe flavor is almost like bourbon. Taste of licking the barrel, also some fruitiness. I love it. Upped.

from Erzbierschof - cloudy dark brown beer with no head retention; strong aroma of prune and cane sugar; very sweet; moderate carbonaton; full-bodied and gently sticky; residual sweetness and a long aftertaste of prunes with strong warming alcohol notes - out of balance and deeply overrated imho

Pours brillian brown with a creamy head, Aroma is caramel,bread and special malts,. no alcohol,.13,5% sure?? Velvet mouthfeel and full taste of special malts and whisky,vanilla.. the best old ale ive ever tasted.

2011 Vintage. 12 oz. bottle, sent from northernbrews (thanks a lot, Jeff), pours a dark brown with an amber tinge and a small beige head. Nose is full of bourbon barrels, English malt, brown sugar and vanilla - quite complex and sweet. Flavour reveals a very sweet bourbon bomb, but with loads of depth and complexity - with lots of vanilla, tons of bourbon barrels, brown sugar, caramel, English malts, a bit of dried dark fruits and alcohol. Palate is intensely syrupy, and while extremely sweet, not cloying. An enjoyable winter warmer and slow hot sipper, perfect for being around a campfire, though it is definitely brutal and a bit over the top. Still, for what it is, solid stuff.

Thanks to AgentZero for this gem- shared at thanksgiving with a few friends

A: Pours a mahogany/ruby color with no head to speak of, which isnt a big deal considering the abv

MF/O: Smooth carbonation, big body, perfect balance, and awesome complexity. This beer is amazing, but it turns out that Old Ales just arent my favorite

Bottle from 2010.  The small pop when I opened the bottle was enticing, but alas this has almost no carbonation.  Murky brown color that reminds me of cold pressed coffee. The lack of carbonation is noticeable, and  bit detrimental to making this a great beer.  Still very nice, though.

355 ml bottle. Rating #3000.
Pours a dark brown colour with a small beigeish head on the edges. Aroma is really rich with dark chocolate, grass, nuts and some mild licorice root notes. Bottle courtesy of "hannont". Colour...cloudy and very dark brown with no head. Nose...soy city with dark raisins and baked plums. Palate...deep, dark and chewy with a sweet dryness up front and a very pruny port-like character that covers the mouth like a Don Pedro Ximenez. Yummy!
Dark brown of color with small white head. An aroma of coconut, vanilla, prunes, sweets and port notes. A flavor of coconut, port, alcohol, vanilla, weak liqurice.

A-- Poured a dark murky brown. Bits of ruby, that are close to purple looking. Just a bit of off white film. Obvious and thick alcohol legs and quick fading spotty lacing. Honestly quite ugly looking beer. 

S-- Oak, bourbon, vanilla, Carmel, toasted marshmallow, figs, alcohol and dark fruits. Really settled down into the barrel characters and marshmallow. Big massive nose. Insanely rich and powerful. 

T-- Big dose of alcohol off the bat. Bourbon, oak, thick and rich carmel, fig, and marshmallow. Only issue is the heat from the ABV but this is just silly in the taste. 

M-- Thick and rich. Slightly sweet. Might have needed a bit more time ageing to smooth out more. Lots of figs, toasted coconut, and stewed plumbs in the mouth. Quite slick and finishes with a bit of alcohol heat and a lot of toasted coconut. Nice. 

O-- Big massive sipper. Close to wine like in complexity. Lots of alcohol is the only real negative to this. Brilliantly done and just a treat to drink if you like high ABV and high gravity beers.

Pours jet black with no head. Aroma of vanilla, oak and bourbon. Not bad, it's still a supper but it's a nice sipper

This beer pours a medium bodied, very sticky dark molasses brown in color with no head at all. The nose is unreal. Bourbon Barrel 4th Dementia is world class!

Bottle generously given to me by Joe Peesie, mucho graces Joe! Served in my Bells tulip: Very deep brown hue nearly opaque with a small frothy head and some spotty lace, some oily legs too. I like this but not as much as the non barreled age 4th Dementia, just like I liked the "base" Fifth Dementia Very Old Ale more than the barrel aged version of that beer.

Taste is quite sweet, with some slight bitter notes at the end. 
Real oily body, slight watery though, with a flat carbonation. Suits this beer very well.

A - Black with no head. No lace as I drink. S - Bourbon, chocolate, fig, date, Caramel malt, dust. T - Same as the nose. Good, but a tad too much for me personally. P - Sits heavy on the palate. O - A well executed beer, but a bit "big" for me. Ill look to try this one again in the future.

Thanks to chpueblo22 for getting me this! 12 oz. bottle poured into a snifter. Pours a deep, dark reddish brown with a nice, creamy tan head. Beautiful lacing. Really looks nice. Aroma is very sweet and very boozy! Vanilla, bourbon, toffee, figs, raisin, and brown sugar. Taste is sweet as well; brown sugar, vanilla, fig, dark fruit, bourbon. Youd think at 13.5% that the alcohol would be really present, but its masked very well. Body is big, mouthfeel is thick, and theres a nice, lingering bourbon finish. Overall, reminds me a lot of Abacus, but sweeter. As far as old ales go, its a little too sweet for me. Definitely a slow sipper, but I enjoyed it, and it lives up to its claim! Glad I got to try it

Flat pour, no lace. Seriously ugly, murky brown color, nasty lookin brew. Nose of plums, alcohol, whisky and faint licorice. Body is med/full, coating on the palate, no carbonation, lifeless. Lotsa boozy flavors, whisky and alcohol with some dark fruit notes of plum, raisin and a hint of chocolate and caramel. Sweet, warming, boozy finish. Did not age too gracefully i,d say. Props to weisguy for a shot at this legend.

light brown with minimal head. huge flavor mix. fruit, caramel, bourbon, wood. somehow this isnt a complete mess and it all meshes into a very tasty beer. you wont mistake this for a low abv beer, but alcohol is pretty well hidden.

Poured from 12oz bottle to brandy snifter. 2011 vintage:

Poured like a sun brewed sweet tea with a beige head that swells briefly after a rigorous pour, only to subside back out to a thin ring that will go on to provide distinct lacing. Sexy legs follow shortly after.

The bourbon barrel is the dominant player in the nostrils. Bits of graham cracker, smokey wood, caramel and toffee malts, figs and raisin, burnt sugar, more bourbon. The balance of all these flavors really overshadow the massive ABV.

Wow. Very, very tasty stuff. Like a liquified boozy smore. Chocolate, raisin, vanilla, bourbon, bourbon, toffee, bourbon, charred wood, molasses, coffee, bourbon. This stuff rocks.

Damn, shorty.

2010 Vintage. Enjoyed in a Hill Farmstead Glass at 45 Degrees F.

A - Dark brown. Almost plum or blueberry appearance when held against the light. Absolutely no head and fantastic alcohol runners on the glass swirl.

S - bourbon, oak and smoked malts.

T - Huge tobacco taste, licorice, hints of vanilla, bourbon, oak, roasted malts.

M - No carbonation at all, big body, dry and lingering bits of bourbon 

O - I keep trying Old ales and keep being very disappointed with them. This was no exception to that rule. Too boozy, to must musty like eating the dust on an old leather bound dictionary that hasnt been touched for a decade. Its like spending the day in a morgue. Just very bad taste in my mouth...and unfortunately...drain pour on the last half.

2010. Thanks pete! Huge Beer. Apricot, candy floss, bourbon, whisky, tar and smoke on the nose. Rich taste - Raisins, bourbon, ash, candi sugar. Not a long finish. Hides 13.5 well, although  alcool heat present as it warms.Very good, just missing the length and depth of the great BWs and OAs.

Sampled from a 12oz bottle. Poured a medium colored brown, with a small off-white/tan head. Aroma was dark, dried fruits with notes of bourbon and oak. Flavor was full of alcohol booze, but was enjoyable enough due to the bourbon notes, the toffee, the caramel, and the dried fruits. Enjoyable.

Wow, this is how my friends roll. Just crack this open for the hell of it. Smell is of dark fruit, bourbon and malt. Whoa dang taste! Super sweet but smooth and well blended. Reminds me of king henry. Great beer! Thanks Allen.

2011 Bottle picked up at the source, and sampled immediately after regular 4th Dementia. Pours a dark brown, but not as dark as regular 4th Dem. a little bit of khaki head that becomes an instantaneous ring around the glass. A couple spot of lacing, unlike its father. Smell is sooooo damn complex. Vanilla, bananas, plumbs, raisins, fig, wood (oak I assume), sugar, whiskey of some sort. Tastes sweet and boozy, dark fruit, soft on the tongue, with a little bite. I think I like this better than the OG.

UPDATED: MAY 2, 2012 2010 Bottle. Muddy and dark amber in appearance with a small beige head. Aroma is of overripe fruits, bourbon, walnuts, and oak. Flavor is extremely boozy even though its been aging for two years. Malts dominate it - toffee, caramel, ripe dates, licorice. Very viscous/oily with little carbonation. Some slight bitterness in the finish.
Pours dark black with a small head.  Wonderful aromas of dark fruit and booze.  Rich deep and complex.  Dark fruit, chocolate, caramel, and nice barrel notes. Ngreat stuff.

Pours dark brown with a few bubbles for a head. Strong aroma of molasses, bourbon, vanilla, and wood.  Taste is similar with a lot of sweetness and alcohol on the finish.  Full body and sticky on the palate with a nice warming on the way down.  Very good.

Bottle thanks to rogee64 .  Pours a very dark brown with almost no head.  Aroma of bourbon, wood, caramel, chocolate, raisins, coconut.  Taste is sweet, with more bourbon and dark fruit flavors, just a little alcohol.  Dry woody, alcoholic finish.  This beer is incredibly smooth, buttery even.  Very full bodied, soft carbonation.

On draft at kuhnhenn served in a snifter. Aroma is just booze and malt, as it warmed up the smell became extremely complex, notes of dark fruit and a delightful whiff of bourbon. Taste was breath taking, for such a high abv beer it drank extremely smooth. As you would expect, very chewy, love this beer.

Bottle thanks to FlandersNed.  Deep brown with amber-red hues and thin tan-yellow head that dissipates quickly.  Aroma of smooth, soft bourbon, light oak, caramel, toffee, molasses, faint toasted/roasted malt and a bit of over-ripe fruit.  Flavor is initially sweet toffee, brown sugar, caramel and bourbon, but finishes well attenuated leaving lower than expected amounts of sweetness and mostly light bourbon, toasted malt, and toffee.  Light alcohol warmth.  Booze can be found nowhere in the flavor.  Nice.

Bottle at Papsø.
Muddy orange-red coloured with a small off-white head.
Sweet and fruity aroma dominated by dried fruits and caramel with notes of vanilla, oak and liquorice.
Sweet and fruity flavour of caramel, dried fruits, oak, vanilla and alcohol.
Sweet and warming alcoholic finish.

bottle at papsoe. clear brown, small offwhite head.
aroma is boozy and phenolic, spicy roasted malts, 
flavor is bourbon.phenolic, wood, spicy malts, booze is too strong compared to the rest.

Bottle at Papsø. Murky medium red-brown beer with a very small, quickly disappearing beige head. Aroma is oak, caramel, vanilla, preserved fruits, a little peat. Very sweet, sticky, spicy, vanilla notes, wood. Very macho, not bad, just not my preference.

Bottle 35,5 cl. Courtesy of MasterSki. Vintage 2010. Pours a cloudy, murky brown with no head. Sweet vanillaish Bourbon aroma. Rich body, very low carbonation, caramel, sweet vanillaish oak, licorice all-sorts. Warming alcohol finish. A nice beer but nowhere near Top 50 in my book. 120412

Dark chocolate brown pour with a minute cap of off white foam.  Served slightly chilled.  Opaque.  Huge sweet bourbon notes in the front of the nose. Malt for days, lots of caramel, bourbon, vanilla and some wood. Flavors were slightly boozy, full of bourbon and vanilla sweetness. Not sure if the barrel aging toned the overall sweetness down on this one but this was much better than the original. Much more drinkable and well rounded. Syrupy and thick mouthfeel, light but present carbonation(LA). Top notch and up there with angels share, if not better.  Paired with a La Casita Criolla from Tatuaje.

Pours an opaque dark brown with a thin lt mocha head.  Aroma has significant dark fruit and candied fruit...fig...mild bourbony notes.  Flavor has layers of dark and candied fruit, roasty malts, mild chocolate, and smooth bourbon...caramel and toffee.  Mouthfeel is full and silky with a bourbony finish that has mild dark fruit and warms with lt vanilla.

UPDATED: JUN 5, 2013 2011 Vintage.  Poured into snifter.  Deep dark brown pour with no head.  Amazing bourbon aroma.  Smells incredibly sweet and malty.   Incredibly smooth bourbon taste that warms all the way to the finish.  Very sticky mouthfeel.  Other tastes I pick up are butterscotch, plums, cherries, and molasses.  Very little alcohol burn at the end.  Love Kuhnhenns and love this beer!  Re-rate 6/5/13 - Ive had this numerous times now with different vintages.  So far, the older the better.  Fresh bottles are an assault on the senses.  Overpowering booziness and bourbon.  Older vintages really mellow out and become much more smooth and malty.  My one issue is that the carbonation seems to be gone after about a year or so.  Other than that, a two or three year old bottle of this is one of the best sippers out there.

UPDATED: APR 21, 2012 Had both on tap at Kuhnhenn and a bottle at home.  Dark brown with a finger of head.  Big gobs of lace.  Aroma of bourbon, cherry, candy, dark caramel, slight booze.  Complex taste of candied dark fruit, bourbon, vanilla, dark toffee, raisin, wood.  Some alcohol warming but the barrle is integrated well without dominating this beer.  A sipper and one ill  be cellaring.
Date: March 24, 2012 Mode: Bottle Source: DalzAle tasting Description: 2010 bottle, brown pour with limited head.  Aroma was sweet, bourbon and dark fruit.  Taste was consistent and smooth.
12 ounce bottle pour.  Thanks Madvike!  Light brown in color with a light head.  Oaky with a nice light bourbon taste,  Very smooth and enjoyable.

2011 bottle 13.5% abv. on the label through trade. Pour has a dark earthy brown color with a touch of tan fizzy head that did not stay around long. Aroma has mild oxidation, vanilla, some bourbon, brown sugar, dark fruit, and some dust. Mouth feel is hefty and sticky with little carbonation but there is some kicking around. Flavor brings on more of the old ale, sticky malt, bourbon, mellow wood, dark fruit, sweetness, mild bitterness, and chocolate. Wow, this is hot and after sitting in the glass for a bit has not killed it back. Super sipper type beer that took some time to get through. Glad they put this in a 12 ounce bottle.

UPDATED: JUL 29, 2012 Bottle from Bierkompass.de cons 2012-07-27 Mölndal
AR: white peppery, chocolate, coffee
AP: dark mahogny, frothy creamy stothy deminishing head
F: sticky sugary feeling, maderia, plum liquid, chocolate, coffee, warming feeling new rating 3,8 - keep average 3,9!

Shared bottle many thx Blafa cons 2012-03-16 Göteborg
Ar: rasins, plums, heavy sweetnees, evidente alcholic
Ap: stickey liquid - dark oak, wee beige head
F: loads of alcholic, rasins, plumcake, preserved cherries soked in vodka, chocolate... A bit to much - but does it matter?

UPDATED: JUL 30, 2012 First rating12 fl oz bottle thanks to Clyx!Sampled on March 16, 2012Cloudy brown color, very small brown head. Raissin, chocolate, alcohol scent, some wood. Chocolate, raissin, alcohol taste. Dry wood and alcohol aftertaste. Warming alcohol, tounge burning at first. Smooth mouthfeel, medium bitterness.At first way to evident alcohol, though it does tone down with a few more sips, gets more easy to drink. With the dissapearing alcohol, the wood and bourbon comes through stornger and sort of dominates too much for my taste. Very nice, though if it was pushed down to perhaps 11% ABV or so might fit my taste better.7/2/7/4/14=3.4RerateBottle 12 fl oz / 355 ml thanks to Nisse666! Sampled on July 29, 2012Very dark brown color, small yellow head. Sweet, raissin, alcohol scent. Malty, grainy, sugary, roasted taste. Warming alcohol. Smooth mouthfeel, medium high bitterness.8/3/7/4/15=3.7

Bottle pours a really dark brown next to no head.  Tastes smells of bourbon oak prune booze soy sauce. medium sweetness, lightly bitter, salty, medium body, thick feel, soft carbonation, Freaking awesome beer would love to have lots of these in stock. The flow of all the flavored mix do well with each.  Great freaking beer. Wow.

From 12 oz bottle, generously shared by Jan & Alice from De Bierkoning (thanks guys!). Brown color (I think, it was dark), no head. Aromas: old, wood, sweet fruit/raisins, alcohol/bourbon. Flavor: rather sweet, alcohol, bourbon. Alcohol is warming, mouthfeel is syruppy. Soft carbonation. Finishes slightly dry with fruit.  Really great!

2011 bottle. Pours dark and cloudy with a ring for a head. Aroma is bourbon, vanilla, caramel malts. Flavor is bourbon, vanilla, caramel malts and hints of barrel. Has a great bourbon finish. Love this beer!

36cl, Vintage 2010, as 4th D Olde Ale Barrel Aged, exclusive American brew, thx to Secret Santa!, complex brew, sweet/malty and slightly alcoholic/vinous, not too heavy, yet balanced, cloudy, nearly no head, very good Winter brew, yet very expensive!, WOW!

From notes.  First reviewed 1/12/2011.  Served on tap at Kuhnhenn in a tulip. 

Bourbon Barrel Fourth Dementia is bistre in color with walnut edges. A small off-white head starts firm, then fades to mostly a ring. Not much lace, but the head reaffirms itself with each sip or swirl. Not a ton of lace expected here with such a big ABV.

Great aroma, there is no doubt about it. Tons of molasses, plums, raisins, fig, caramel, and dark roasted malts. Bourbon and oak just add another level of complexity, although each aroma is easily identifiable in its own right.

Once I smelled this, I figured the taste would be incredible, and it does not disappoint. Just tons of flavor throughout each sip. The bourbon barrel aging interacts perfectly with the original beer. Very complex. Caramel malt is the first flavor to be noticed, and then an bourbon burning that is present throughout. Sweet molasses and roasted malt, figs, and plums provide the sweetness. Light earthy hops, then oak, smoke, and a touch of bourbon to finish. Very satisfying.

The creaminess is immediately noticeable, with the body of the beer quashing the carbonation. Alcohol warms the throat and stomach throughout, and the lips are left a little bit sticky. A very full body.

Barrel aging claims another victory. It just made a great beer even better. Obviously a sipper, but I would be satisfied sipping this for a long time.

Bottle courtesy Job, thanks buddy. Pour is hazy brown with a small tan head. Aroma of vanilla, butterscotch, dark fruit, molasses. Taste is big raisin/dark fruits, vanilla, bourbon, molasses. Palate is sticky sweet, slightly cloying, soft, creamy, sweet finish.

2011 12 ounce bottle from Kuhnhenn brewpub.  Pours murky deep nut brown.  Aroma is crazy strong and has butterscotch, vanilla, bourbon, and toasted marshmallow.  Wow!!!  As for taste, also wow.  Pretty much the same as everything I listed for the aroma.  Has a bit of bitter and alcoholic bite near the end; how did they get it bitter even with all that sweetness.  Just amazing stuff; very glad I got two bottles from the brewery, rather than one.  Heaven in a bottle.

2011 bottle shared by kevinsenn, which he picked up at the brewpub. Smells like a combination of blue cheese and Werthers Original butterscotch candies. So butterscotchy, with toasted marshmallow and vanilla notes. Very, very intense aroma. Deep nut brown, almost opaque, with just about no head. That toffee comes right out of the aroma and onto your tongue. Everything except the cheese, actually, translates directly from the aroma into the flavour. This is very thick and very sweet, with just a hint of a roasted bitter finish. This is delicious. Booze is definitely not as present as youd expect. Its there, but its not the 13.5% you think itd be. How do you make this stuff? Good gods.

Bottle big thanks to John, thanks buddy!  Pour is dark brown with very little head.  Almost  port- like. aroma is huge brown sugar, vanilla, light brandy,  light squash,  and very faint alcohol. Flavor is deep toffe malt, faint vanilla, notable Brady notes, and a huge long burnt brown sugar finish with a pat of butter on top. Hearty and delicious.

Bottle at a recent tasting...  Poured deep, dense brownish with a tan head.  This was intense and potent.  Loads of bourbon, oak, and booze here.  Dark malt sweetness reminiscent of toffee, caramel, and butterscotch.  Warming whiskey heat, dark fruits.  Thick, full bodied and coated the palate nicely.

2010 courtesy of Scott. Appearance is extremely dark brown, good legs, minimal amount of lacing. Not an attractive beer. Nose is intense with the barrel (vanilla, caramel, toffee, brown sugar) with some dark fruits such as prunes. Taste is heavy on the barrel as well, as one would expect. Really heavy on the caramel and honey in a good way. The sweetness and the bitterness work well together. However, this is still pretty hot even after nearly 2 years, and it detracts from the experience. Palate is smooth and velvety. Theres enough carbonation in the body to keep this one lively. 
Overall: Quite enjoyable, but theres a few factors missing which keep this one from turning sublime. Reminds me a lot of Hair of the Dog, but its missing a few components which would push it into the same realm.

12oz bottle, dark cloudy brown hue, with a beige head, leaving some laces, nice strong boozy bourbonish, oak barrel, coconut nose, with some fuitcake, mild chocolate, brownie, liquorish accents, and some vanilla, brown sugar, dark dried fruit, toffeeish, caramel, toasted, chocolate malt, molasses notes in the aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a good sweet warmth alcoholic, phenolic, bourbonish woodiness, faint brandy liquorish, fruity character with some dried raisin, date, fig, prune, fruitcake, burnt oak barrel flavors, with a molasses, alcoholised chocolate cup, toffee, toasted, caramelized, chocolate malty backbone, leading towards a warming, fruity, malty, bourbonish finish.

Bottle received in a trade.  Sampled along the regular version with 2mikes.  Dark red-brown with a tiny head that dissipated immediately.  Nose is rich sweet malt, toffee, caramel, brown sugar, and booze.  Taste is massive booze and rich sweet.  Hot and sharp.  Medicine and cherry and warming bourbon.  Big and fuzzy and gorgeous.
Bottle. Pours brown-grey. No head. Very sweet. Liquor, vanilla, sweet chocolate, alcohol and a small touch of wood. Incredible smooth. A bit too sweet and one dimensional, otherwise very good.

Bottle.
Pours grayish brown without any head.
Aroma of cola, petrol, bourbon and malt.
Very sweet taste of licorice, milk chocolate and xmasy spices.
Lots of taste without beeing to heavy. Bit HotD like.

12oz bottle. Pours deep chestnut, topped with a small tan head. Really enticing aroma, with lots of wood, vanilla and dark fruit in the forefront, with molasses and raisin the back. Dark fruit hits the palate first, with the woody, boozy character building and taking over. Bourbon lingers on the palate. A little boozy, but otherwise its pretty solid.

Huge thanks to daknole for busting out another monster! Bottle pours deep brown with a tan head. Aroma shows notes of bourbon soaked chocolate toffee cake, vanilla, brown sugar, and roasted malt. Flavor delivers the same with additional notes of oak, delhi dates, dried dark fruit, and maple cookies. Overall body is moderate to full and finishes with a touch of warmth. This beer has a massive amount of depth while still managing to be balanced.

2011 12 oz. bottle courtesy of mikem409 - Pours a cloudy brown color with a 1/4 finger thick tan head.  Aroma is dark fruit, oak, brown sugar, and toasted malt.  Light spotty lacing.  Little carbonation.  Flavor is toasted malt, bourbon, vanilla, and dark fruit.  Very nice.  Alcohol is noticeable.  Full body.  An excellent sipper.  Thanks Mike.
shared by someone at the Cleveland tasting, this thing is sweet with the barrel taking some sweetness but not nearly enough to me, glad to have tried it, glad i didnt bother seeking it out.

12 ounce bottle. Poured cloudy dark brown with a thin ring of head. Nose of bourbon, vanilla, caramel, and toffee. The flavor is rich with vanilla, bourbon, toffee, and prunes. Very rich, I enjoyed this more then the standard 4th D.

Bottle @ Danish Summer Gathering, Ulfborg 2011. Many many thanks to Jan and Charlotte fr this. Raisin brown color with a tiny brown head that disappears. Wonderful sweet malty aroma with roasted notes, caramel, bourbon,vanilla,wood. Just lovely ! Sweet malty flavour, easy drinkable without noticing the high abv, wood,bourbon,caramel, Very complex, yet extremely balanced and drinkable.
Amazing! Very little carbonation. Sweet, hides the alcohol great and is one of the better beers barrel aged I have had

Draft.  Aroma is powerful -- lots of bourbon with some malt behind.  Deep tan with some red color, murky, no head.  Full body and strong alcohol.  The beer warmed on me overtime.  Very true to what this beer claims to be.

(Bottle) Pours beautiful dark mahogany brown with red highlight. Almost no head. The aroma is fantastic  super robust caramel, toffee, honey and dark bread blends well with buttery, woodsy and coconut/vanilla-driven oak/bourbon. Undertones of fancy alcohol, dried fruits, syrup, milk chocolate and dried orange peel/orange marmalade. Extreme but well-balanced nose. The flabvour is medium to heavily sweet (but the alcohol balance the finish), light to medium  and bitter and tiny acidic. Bread, caramel, honey, syrup, dark fruits, tropical marmalade, butter, vanilla, coconut milk, wood and toffee. The mouthfeel is sticky, round and oily with almost no carbonation. Light numbing finish with bready and honey overtones. Full bodied. Simple but uber great!

On tap at winter solstice. Pours extremely dark brown with very small ring of off white bubbles. Aromas of bourbon, vanilla, light coconut, caramel and some dark malts. Aroma is really nice. Flavors of bourbon, molasses, vanilla, caramel, booze, raisans and other dark fruits, bit of tannis quality, and bit of hop bitterness in there at the end. Mouthfeel is a bit oily but works. Very nice. I would imagine Adam from the wood tasting like this. Has that same sort of dry and dusty quality to it, in a very good way though. Cant wait to see how the bottle version tastes.
big thanks to bu11zeye for this one.  deep rich amber pour with no head.  thick, malty, vanilla, ridiculous nose.  chewy on the palate, caramel, fruits, no sign of alcohol at all.

12 oz bottle from Doodler. Thanks a ton Scott! Nose of toffee, prunes, tobacco, and hints of vanilla and oak. Lightly hazy golden brown with a small beige head. Flavor is darkly fruity, musty oak, vanilla, toffee, and light bourbon.

12oz bottle picked up at the brewpub, 2010 Vintage. Pours a deep brown colored body with a touch of ruby around the edges. Thin, brown head that dissipates quickly and leaves a light lacing throughout. Aroma jumps out of the bottle immediately upon opening and it is damn good. Tons of rich toffees and dark fruits consisting of dates, raisins, plums, and some vinous fruits. A nice bourbon and vanilla with some barrel behind the big malts. Some slightly sticky brown sugar, molasses, caramel, a touch of toast, and light cocoas. A light warming alcohol in the nose. Flavor is similar. Big and rich, slightly sticky and warm toffees, caramel, and brown sugar up front with lots of dark fruits. Plenty of raisins with some vinous fruits and more molasses. A few wood tannins with a nice bourbon and vanilla in the middle as the alcohol becomes noticeable, but not distracting. Toast and cocoa really come on nicely towards the end as this finishes with some booze and an alcohol warmth while staying sweet, oaky, and slightly spicy with lots of dark fruits. This does dry a bit with a nice barrel character before leaving a lengthy aftertaste. Full, oily, slightly sticky body with a light carbonation. Overall, my kind of beer. Big, bold, warming, and balanced while hiding the ABV% very well. Tons of rich, sweet malts with lots of dark fruits and a nice mix of bourbon, vanilla, wood, and cocoa. A really well put together barrel-aged beer.

12 oz. bottle, 2010 vintage aged about a year I would guess.  The pour yields a dark and lightly hazy reddish chestnut colored body with a thin, swirly, khaki colored film.  A dense wash of spots slowly rejoins the body, forming a bubbly ring at the edge of the surface.  The nose is ultra rich and decadent, showing loads of stewed dark raisins, figs, dates, and blackened caramel.  Hints of cocoa, cola, and sorghum all ring through, as do surprisingly potent citrus and earthen hops.  An oaky, bourbony, boozy shroud envelops everything, fighting for top billing rather than assuaging the other elements.  Flavors are similarly structured, bordering on exceedingly woody and warm with alcohol, loaded with rich, dark caramel and buttery toffee.  Underlying fruits arent as well defined as they are on the nose.  They are seemingly more centered on scorched dates and other muddled, stewed dark fruits.  The juicy, citrusy, bitter hoppiness is quite intense, though, which is actually welcomed here.  It resembles a black barley wine in a number of ways, which I suppose is the closest cousin to the old ale (though notedly more hoppy).  The palate is nearly full, and it would be decidedly too syrupy if it werent for the lively, intense carbonation.  oozy heat comes with the territory, I suppose, but it is certainly more intense than I care for (and Im a whiskey head).  All in all, its a solid, decadent slow sipper for a cold night, but I prefer the virgin 4th Dementia to the barrel aged version.

In short: A extremely sweet, extremely boozy and very bourbonny syrupy sipper.  It is what it is
How: Bottle 12oz.  Consumed when approximately 1 year of age I think.  Bottle sent to me by WeisGuy, thanks a lot Shane
The look: Cloudy dirty burgundy body with no head
In long: Nose is an attack of brutal boozy bourbon over sweet rich toffee.  This beer smells like a alcoholised dessert where the pastry chef went overboard with the alcohol.  Thick syrupy sticky body, low carbonation, sweetest toffee ever, more brown sugar, a lot of booze, oaky vanilla, light notes of rasisins.  Alcohol is very apparent and each percent of the 13.5% is showing if not more.  Finish is alcohol burn and a woody astringency that helps make this monster a bit more drinkable.  Not a very good beer but despite my complaints this is an acceptable brutal beer, a winter-warmer that you can sip slowly.  With all the progress of the past 20 years, big boozy sugary brutal beers is the new evolution of the American craftbeer?!?!?  But thats not surprising coming from a nation that has put in orbit a sophisticated array of satellites and now mostly uses it to locate the nearest Burger King.

12oz bottle, 2010. Dark dark brown pour with a ruby hue, minimal tan head that disappears almost instantly. A mellow but powerful bourbon aroma - vanilla, oak, booze and toffee - malt profile is there but hidden, bit of plum and raisin, and oddly enough some roasted coconut. Low carbonation, full body, prickly on the palate from the booze (still a little hot), sweet, lots of bourbon, vanilla, oak. Finish continues sweet, long lasting great combination of vanilla, toffee, bourbon, malt, and wood. This definitely reminds me of BCS because its one of the best bourbon aged beers I have had - not overwhelming (although this bottle was a little hot - think it could do with sitting a while longer) - yet lets the bourbon barrel process shine. Delicious - would love to be able to buy a case.

UPDATED: MAR 30, 2012 12 oz bottle. Pours a thick, dark red with no head. Aromas of caramel, vanilla, toffee, raisin, woody and hints of alcohol. Flavors are so intense. Mouthfell is wonderful. Sweet up front that ends bitter and a bit hot. There is so much to this beer. Gets better as it mellows in the glass. Awesome beer.

12 oz bottle. Pours deep mahogany with a tiny head that instantly fizzes out to nothing. Big aroma of toffee, dates, boozy bourbon, oak, & vanilla. The flavor is strong, hot bourbon and alcohol up front, then the rich toffee and caramel malt come in and smooth out the flavor, no real hop bitterness. Medium to full body with mild carbonation and a thick, soft mouth feel. Overall a great beer, lots of bourbon character in this one but maybe thats why I like it so much.

Bottle at home - Tasting. Clear very dark red/brown - white head. Raisins, fruity, bourbon, boozy, nutty, light honey notes, licorice, oiley, dark fruits, sweetness, ligh tryebread. Lovely. Do it with a triple chocolate porter chocolat, raisins.

Bottled (thx Sarro for this). dark amber coloured. murky. small beige head. aroma of ripe fruits, sweetness, light alcohol, vanilla, some wood. flavour of ripe fruits, sweetness, spice, alcohol, wood, vanilla,  and I could go on. medium to full bodied. ends on a sweet, fruity and light spiced note. Yummy.

Big thanks to bu11zeye for sharing this bottle.

The beer pours a reddish-amber color with a tan head. The aroma is full of brown sugar, bourbon and raisins. I also get some nice alcohol notes. All of the components in the aroma are very, very nice. 

The flavor is just as complex and just as nice. I get a lot of brown sugar and molasses notes, as well as a lot of bourbon, oak, maple and vanilla. The alcohol is present, but it is not as strong as expected from a 13.5 percent ABV beer.

Medium moutfeel and medium carbonation.
Completely flat and murky. Smells like dirty laundry with some bourbon. Taste is Completely different. Big bourbon, maple syrup and hops. Malts and alcohol.

2010 vintage. A big thanks to the traders who sent me this.

A - Pours a caramel color with a few bubbles, my expectations instantly drop.

S - Molasses, bourbon, vanilla, oak.

T - Like a tootsie roll in a shot of bourbon. Chocolate, vanilla, molasses, and oak. Its decadent and hard to see how it could get better.

M/D - The lack of carbonation is perfect. I thought it would be hard to finish a bottle, but the second it warmed up I couldnt stop sipping it. A great barrel aged old ale, probably the best out there consider the price and availably of it.

(12oz bottle thanks to bu11zeye) clearish ruby with wispy tan bubbles. Nose of rich caramel, marshmallow, maple, raisin, alcohol, complex, rich decadent, this beer smells amazing. Taste of caramel, raisin, toasty marshmallow, candied dried fruit, complex and delicious. Medium thick body, a bit under-carbonated and linger of oats on the palate.

Bottle 12fl.oz.[ Courtesy of Secret Summer Santa ]. Clear dark amber colour with a average, fizzy, fair lacing, fully diminishing, off-white head. Aroma is light heavy malty, roasted, caramel, sweet malt, coconut, wood, oak, vanilla, bourbon, alcohol. Flavour is heavy sweet and moderate to heavy bitter with a long duration, dark roasted, wood, alcohol, bourbon, coconut. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20110819]

12oz bottle courtesy of Styles. Pours a deep ruby, almost brown in my snifter, with a thin off-white head that that quickly fades to a thin ring. Aroma is heavy with bourbon, with notes of vanilla, toffee, and oak. body is full. Flavor is sweet malt, with a lot of toffee, and vanilla. The bourbon character is much smoother than the aroma would suggest.

12oz bottle, 2010 edition, courtesy of ibrew2or3. thanks so much for this one, dave! pours a beautiful, slightly sticky, hazy, cherry-wood color with a whispy beige head that dissipates quickly but leaves thick sheets of lace on the glass. aroma is absolutely stunning with huge notes of toffee, charleston pralines, and toasted marshmallows backed by heavy notes of figs, raisins, and dark cherry with smooth, woody oak, bourbon, and cinnamon spice bread that mellow into vanilla and sweet maple as it warms. flavor is simply wonderful as well and picks up a bit more fruit in the form of baked apples, raisins, plums, and dark cherries that layer atop rich toffee, subtle chocolate, and vanilla backed by smooth bourbon, spices, and toasted wood with the elegant hints of maple showing through on the back end. palate is rich and full bodied with a smooth balance of sweetness, tart dark fruits, and warming bourbon. overall, a marvelous old ale that definitely deserves to be in the top 50.

Bottle courtesy of Doodler (BIG thanks Scott!!) poured a clear reddish brown with a lingering ring of tan foam. Aromas of toffee, bourbon, alcohol, plum, raisin and light oak. Palate was medium bodied and smooth with a warming finish. Flavors of toffee, plum, raisin, bourbon, light orange and light oak with a smooth warming lingering fruity bourbon finish.

Bottle shared by Plovmand, thanks a lot bro! 
Delish stuff! 
Pours mahogany with a tan rim.
Lovely sweet bourbon aroma with notes of caramel, figs, vanilla booze, raisins, rock candy and prunes. 
The flavour is dominated by bourbon but also raisins, caramel, figs and vanilla. 
Lovely brew, would love to try it again.
